snippet: Republicans said they would back down on the borrowing limit to open a window for Congress to pass a budget and begin talks on long-term deficit reduction.
abstract: House Republicans, backing down from hard-line stance, announce agreement to lift federal government’s statutory borrowing limit for three months if both chambers of Congress pass budget in that time to clear the way for negotiations on long-term deficit reduction; proposal significantly reduces threat of impending default by federal government.

byline.contributor: Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Williamsburg, Va.

lead_paragraph: Republicans said they would back down on the borrowing limit to open a window for Congress to pass a budget and begin talks on long-term deficit reduction.

headline.seo: House G.O.P. Agrees to Lift Debt Ceiling for 3 Months
headline.main: In Reversal, House G.O.P. Agrees to Lift Debt Limit
headline.print_headline: In Reversal, House G.O.P. Agrees to Lift Debt Limit
